mapper.sql: id, name, url, sort, parentId, enable, creater, created, modifier, modified, icon, type, permission, fieldType
mapper.select:
select
from sys_permission where enable=1 and exists(select 1 from sys_role_user JOIN sys_role_permission where sys_role_user.rid=sys_role_permission.rid and sys_role_permission.mid=sys_permission.id and sys_role_user.uid=#{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}) order by sort desc
select count(1) from sys_permission where type=0

select
from sys_permission where type=0
and parentId=0

select
from sys_permission where type=0 and enable=1 and exists(select 1 from sys_role_user JOIN sys_role_permission where sys_role_user.rid=sys_role_permission.rid and sys_role_permission.mid=sys_permission.id and sys_role_user.uid=#{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}) order by sort desc

select
from sys_permission where type=0 and enable=1 and (fieldType=#{ftype,jdbcType=INTEGER} or fieldType=2) and exists(select 1 from sys_role_user JOIN sys_role_permission where sys_role_user.rid=sys_role_permission.rid and sys_role_permission.mid=sys_permission.id and sys_role_user.uid=#{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}) order by sort desc

select
from sys_permission where type=0 and enable=1 order by sort desc

update sys_permission
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
url = #{url,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
sort = #{sort,jdbcType=TINYINT},
parentId = #{parentid,jdbcType=INTEGER},
enable = #{enable,jdbcType=BIT},
creater = #{creater,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
created = #{created,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
modifier = #{modifier,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
modified = #{modified,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
icon = #{icon,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
type = #{type,jdbcType=BIT},
permission = #{permission,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
fieldType = #{fieldType,jdbcType=TINYINT},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
